visuals.title: A Simple Periodic Signal: The Sine Wave
visuals.description: A continuous sine wave repeating every T₀ seconds. Notice how every point x(t) is identical to x(t + T₀) — this is the defining property of periodicity.

visuals.title: Interactive: Explore Periodic Signals
visuals.description: Adjust the frequency and amplitude to see how periodic signals change. Watch how increasing ω₀ shortens the period T₀.

visuals.title: Composite Periodic Signal: x(t) = 11 + 4sin(5t) + (4/3)sin(15t)
visuals.description: This signal looks complex, but it is built from just three components: a DC offset (11), a fundamental sinusoid at ω₀ = 5, and a third harmonic at 3ω₀ = 15. The fundamental period is T₀ = 2π/5.

visuals.title: Interactive: Period ↔ Frequency Relationship
visuals.description: Drag the slider to change frequency. Watch the period update in real time. This builds intuition for the inverse relationship T₀ = 1/f₀.

visuals.title: Euler's Formula: e^{jθ} on the Unit Circle
visuals.description: The complex exponential e^{jθ} traces the unit circle. The horizontal projection gives cos(θ) and the vertical projection gives sin(θ).

visuals.title: Inter-Domain Analysis: Time ↔ Frequency
visuals.description: The same signal x(t) has two equivalent representations. Analysis extracts X_k from x(t); synthesis reconstructs x(t) from X_k. No information is lost.

visuals.title: Magnitude Spectrum |X_k|
visuals.description: The magnitude spectrum shows how much energy each harmonic carries. X₀ = 11 is the DC, |X₁| = 2 is the fundamental, and |X₃| = 2/3 is the third harmonic.

visuals.title: Phase Spectrum ∠X_k
visuals.description: The phase spectrum shows the phase angle of each coefficient. For real signals, the phase is anti-symmetric: ∠X_{−k} = −∠X_k.

visuals.title: Interactive: Build a Signal from Harmonics
visuals.description: Add harmonics one by one and watch the signal take shape. Start with DC, add the fundamental, then higher harmonics. This is Fourier synthesis in action.

visuals.title: Interactive: Fourier Coefficient Visualization
visuals.description: Explore how changing the signal shape affects the Fourier coefficients. See the magnitude and phase spectra update in real time as you modify the waveform.
